intro: Rhamnicastrum mundii, commonly known as the desert spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is adapted to survive in dry environments, storing water in its thick stems and leaves. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. Rhamnicastrum mundii is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
